thread.title: BUZZ-U.S. STOCKS ON THE MOVE-Apple, Anacor Pharma, Fitbit, Delta Air Lines
thread.title_full: BUZZ-U.S. STOCKS ON THE MOVE-Apple, Anacor Pharma, Fitbit, Delta Air Lines

title: BUZZ-U.S. STOCKS ON THE MOVE-Apple, Anacor Pharma, Fitbit, Delta Air Lines
text:
194.19 +2.06 
(For faster updates on individual market-movers, Eikon users please use search string "STXBZ US"; for the Day Ahead newsletter, http://link.reuters.com/mex49s; for the Morning News Call newsletter, http://link.reuters.com/nex49s ) U.S. stock index futures rose on Monday after euro zone leaders reached an agreement with Greece to move forward with a third bailout loan for the country to avert bankruptcy. 
Dow Jones industrial average futures were up 0.63 percent at 17,781, S&P 500 futures were up 0.63 percent at 2,082 and Nasdaq 100 futures were up 0.80 percent at 4,443.5. 
** APPLE INC (NasdaqGS: AAPL - news ) , Friday close $123.28, +1.29 pct premarket 
Socgen (Paris: FR0000130809 - news ) upgraded the company's stock to "buy" from "hold" citing an expected successful launch of the new iPhone 6S handset in September. 
** PIONEER NATURAL RESOURCES CO (NYSE: PXD - news ) , Friday close $134.46, +1.76 pct premarket 
Morgan Stanley (Xetra: 885836 - news ) raised its rating on the oil and gas explorer's stock to "overweight". 
** ANACOR PHARMACEUTICALS INC (NasdaqGM: ANAC - news ) , Friday close $84.61, +60.08 pct premarket 
The drug developer said preliminary data showed its experimental ointment to treat an itchy skin condition met the main goal of a late-stage study. 
** ASCENA RETAIL GROUP INC, Friday close $16.37, -9.16 pct premarket 
The apparel and footwear retailer cut its full-year 2015 adjusted earnings from continuing operations forecast and also issued a adjusted EBITDA from continuing operations forecast that fell short of analysts' average estimate. The update was mainly due to lower-than-expected sales at Justice and dressbarn and to reflect the move to accelerate the planned merchandise transition at Justice. 
** DELTA AIR LINES INC (NYSE: DAL - news ) , Friday close $42.46, +1.79 pct premarket 
The U.S. carrier will expand its alliance with Brazil's Gol Linhas Aereas Intelligentes SA under a $446 million stock and loan agreement. 
** INGERSOLL-RAND PLC, Friday close $66.41, +1.39 pct premarket 
Stifel raised its rating on the stock to "buy" from "hold" and set a price target of $77. 
** FITBIT INC (NYSE: FIT - news ) , Friday close $42.1, +2.23 pct premarket 
A host of brokerages started coverage of the wearable fitness-tracking device maker's stock. 
** MARKWEST ENERGY PARTNERS LP, Friday close $59.75 
** MPLX LP (NYSE: MPLX - news ) , Friday close $69.05 
** MARATHON PETROLEUM CORP, Friday close $54.49 
MPLX LP, Marathon Petroleum's master limited partnership, will acquire MarkWest Energy for about $15.63 billion, or $78.64 per unit - a premium of about 32 percent to Friday's close. 
** JARDEN CORP (NYSE: JAH - news ) , Friday close $52.31 
The maker of Sunbeam appliances and Coleman outdoor gear, said it would buy disposable tableware maker Waddington Group for about $1.35 billion. 
** AETNA INC (NYSE: AET - news ) , Friday close $114.6, +0.63 pct premarket 
** HUMANA INC (NYSE: HUM - news ) , Friday close $187.25 
U.S. insurance regulators and state attorneys general are lining up to scrutinize Aetna's proposed $33 billion takeover of rival Humana's for potential harm to consumers, complicating what is already expected to be a tough and lengthy review by federal antitrust authorities. 
** UNITED TECHNOLOGIES CORP, Friday close $110.18, +0.17 pct premarket 
** LOCKHEED MARTIN CORP, Friday close $194.19 
Lockheed is the leading candidate to buy United Technologies' Sikorsky helicopter unit in a deal that could value the business at more than $8 billion, a source familiar with the situation said on Friday. 
** PLATFORM SPECIALTY PRODUCTS CORP, Friday close $25.14 
The U.S. chemical maker said it would buy UK's Alent Plc (LSE: ALNT.L - news ) for about 1.35 billion pounds ($2.10 billion) in cash to expand its portfolio and save costs. 
** BLACK HILLS CORP, Friday close $46.84, +2.22 pct premarket 
The power company said on Sunday it signed a deal to buy natural gas utility company SourceGas Holdings LLC for about $1.9 billion. 
** COMCAST CORP, Friday close $63.19 
The cable company said it is beta testing a new cable streaming service called Stream, which will broadcast live TV from HBO and about a dozen other networks for $15 per month. 
** AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC, Friday close $41.21, +1.43 pct premarket 
The largest U.S. airline operator lowered its plans for capacity growth in the United States, seeming to heed investors' calls to slow its expansion in light of weaker-than-expected travel demand. (Compiled by Anannya Pramanick in Bengaluru; Editing by Savio D'Souza)
